intro: Gynandropsis brachycarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited gynandropsis, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, adapted for dispersal by wind. The species is noted for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
